N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 442.12 - Kitchens

State Regulations
(a) Equipment. All kitchens shall be well lighted, properly ventilated, provided with essential and proper equipment for the preparation and serving of
food, storage, refrigeration and freezer facilities, for the number of persons
to be served. (b) Defective utensils. Dishes, glassware and other utensils with chips, cracks
or other defects shall be discarded. (c) Protection from rodents and
insects. Food and dishes shall be protected from rodents and
insects. (d) Cleanliness. All kitchen equipment and surroundings shall be kept
clean. (e) Food
handlers. Employees engaged in the handling and preparation of food
shall meet all State and local health requirements and shall wear proper and
clean apparel and give special attention to personal cleanliness. (f) Compliance with health
and safety regulations. Each institution shall comply with the regulations
relating to kitchen operations for fire protection, safety, sanitation and
health, as set forth by the State, county and local health and fire
departments. Notes
